intro: Eupatorium elongatum, commonly known as swamp boneset, is a perennial herb native to wetland areas of North America. It features tall, slender stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, often growing in moist soils along stream banks and marshes. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in clustered inflorescences, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a rough texture with prominent veins. Eupatorium elongatum is known for its aromatic foliage and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
